net.hudup.core.logistic.ui

Class ProgressEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.EventObject
      • net.hudup.core.logistic.ui.ProgressEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ProgressEvent
extends java.util.EventObject
    For example, there is an application A whose process is to copy file. In the progress of copying, user needs to see the number of transferred bytes. So programmer must implement the interface ProgressListener as class B by defining the method ProgressListener.receiveProgress(ProgressEvent) for showing the number of transferred bytes. Class B is called a progress listener. Moreover the application A needs to register the progression listener (class B). In the method ProgressListener.receiveProgress(ProgressEvent), application A passes necessary information to the progress listener B. Such information is modeled as this class, called progress event including two main variables:
    • The variable progressTotal indicates the total amount of works which will be finished, for example, the total number of bytes which will be transferred.
    • The variables progressStep indicates the current amount of works which were done, for example, the current number of bytes which were transferred.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:

      • ProgressEvent

        public ProgressEvent(java.lang.Object source,
                     int progressTotal,
                     int progressStep,
                     java.lang.String msg)
        Constructor with specified total amount of works and specified current amount of works.
        Parameters:
        source - a reference to the application that issues this event so that the progress listener receives this event.
        progressTotal - total amount of works which will be finished.
        progressStep - current amount of works which were done.
        msg - message which describes this event.
